KeyLocks are the tools you need to sign content digitally and to vouch for other people. Before you can use KeyLocks, you need to create your own KeyLock, choose a passphrase for it and commit the passphrase to memory. This should take about five or ten undisturbed minutes.
You start by creating an anonymous KeyLock and then add identities - such as email and photo ID - to it to improve the credibility of content signed by it. Anonymous signatures confer no credibility.
